account.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a written or spoken description that says what happens in an event or process
account.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Chomsky’s account of how children learn their first language
a blow-by-blow account of how England lost to Portugal

account.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out
account.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: My salary is paid into my bank account.
I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
My husband and I have a joint account (=one that is shared between two people).
account.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an arrangement that you have with a shop or company, which allows you to buy goods or use a service now and pay for them later
account.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Can you charge this to my account please?
account.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a statement that shows how much money you owe for things you have bought from a shop
account.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: James left the restaurant, settling his account by credit card.
account.translation[0].definitions[4].de: an arrangement to sell goods and services to another company over a period of time
account.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Our sales manager has secured several big accounts recently.

something you say or write that gives details about what something or someone is like

account.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an arrangement between a bank and a customer that allows the customer to pay in and take out money; BANK ACCOUNT
account.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: She used her first pay check to open an account (=to start one).

account.translation[2].definitions[1].de: words written on a cheque to show that the account to which it relates has been closed
account.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a record showing a particular part of the finances of a business
account.translation[2].definitions[3].de: the complete set of records showing money coming into and going out of a business, its profits, and its financial situation
account.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: The new accounts contain more bad news for shareholders.
account.translation[2].definitions[4].de: the department of a company that deals with its accounts
account.translation[2].definitions[5].de: an arrangement between a buyer and a seller for payment to be made some time after the buyer receives the goods or services
account.translation[2].definitions[5].ex: No interest is charged provided the account is settled (=the money owed is paid) in full every month.
All clients are sent a monthly account statement (=list of goods or services bought and money owed).
account.translation[2].definitions[6].de: paid as part of the total amount that needs to be paid
account.translation[2].definitions[6].ex: We’ll pay you half of your fee on account.
account.translation[2].definitions[7].ex: Most of this equipment was bought on account.
account.translation[2].definitions[8].de: an organization that is a regular client of a company, especially an ADVERTISING AGENCY
account.translation[2].definitions[8].ex: The agency won several major accounts this year.
